availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Womack and Phebe Womack. Married to Mary C. Womack. Father of Sally E. Womack, John H. Womack, Mary B. Womack, Phebe B. Womack, and George D. Womack. Farmer in Jefferson County in 1850. Farmer in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 1, p. 185B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 1097.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, 2nd District, p. 257A.
